a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Child mortality vs per capita health expenditure, 2019
Healthcare expenditure per capita is measured in current international-$, which adjusts for price
between countries. Child mortality is the share of newborns who die before reaching the age of five.
Current health expenditure per capita, PPP (current international $)
Data source: UN Inter-agency Group for Child Mortality Estimation (via World Bank); World Health Organization (via World Bank)
